title: Textile, late 20th century
medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: narrow-woven strips warp-faced plain weave with tie-dyed warps, discontinuous supplementary weft patterning (brocading), and wrapping
dimensions: Warp x Weft: 174 x 104.1 cm (5 ft. 8 1/2 in. x 41 in.)
creditline: Museum purchase from Textile Department Fund
description: Eleven narrow strips of fabric (each 3 3/4 in. wide) sewn together to make a rectangular panel. Each strip is patterned by a (17 in.) section of narrow blue and white stripes alternating with an equal length section of a wide blue stripe or solid blue area which is decorated with small geometric brocaded shapes in bright colors. The strips are sewn together so that the striped and solid areas form offset blocks. Warp fringed at both ends.

tombstone.epitaph:
Textile, late 20th century.
late 20th century. Medium: cotton
Technique: narrow-woven strips warp-faced plain weave with tie-dyed warps, discontinuous supplementary weft patterning (brocading), and wrapping. Museum purchase from Textile Department Fund. 1979-23-1.
